title: Chemmuthal
text:
Chemmuthal is a <a href="Historic%20site">historic landmark</a> in the <a href="Kanyakumari">Kanyakumari</a> district in the Indian state of <a href="Tamil%20Nadu">Tamil Nadu</a>, <a href="India">India</a>. It is located in Vilavancode <a href="taluk">taluk</a>, in the Killiyoor <a href="Panchayat">Panchayat</a>.
Religion.
The largest <a href="Hindus">Hindu</a> temple in Chemmuthal is called <a href="Sasthamcotta_Sree_Dharma_Sastha_Temple">Sree Dharma Sastha Temple</a> (ஸ்ரீ தர்ம சாஸ்தா). 
Seven other <a href="Hindu">Hindu</a> temples and three <a href="Christianity">Christian</a> churches are near Chemmuthal.
Festivals.
A major festival in this temple is <a href="Karthikai%20Deepam">Karthikai</a> (கார்திகை). During the <a href="festival">festival</a> <a href="Hinduism">Hindu</a> families light small lamps in front of their homes to welcome the god/goddess. During the month of <a href="Karthikai">Karthikai</a>, dishes such as Kozhukatta and Pongal are served as <a href="prasad">prasad</a>am, a religious offering. The celebrations include the lighting of homemade firecrackers, known as <a href="Karthikai%20Deepam%23Special%20Home%20made%20Firework">Chutru</a>. In the evening, singers perform <a href="bhajan">bhajan</a>s at the temple. 
Panguni uttara Mahotsav festival starts during the Tamil month of Panguni.
<a href="Thai%20Pongal">Pongal</a> festival is conducted in the Tamil month of Thai, lasting for two days. This festival is organized by the Vivekananda <a href="Youth%20Club">Youth Club</a>.
